Detailed Description

Collects data structures and functions configuring the analysis job.

Function Documentation

void Configuration::interpretConfig ( int  argc,
char **  argv,
ConfigData &  config 
)

Interpret configuration from command line arguments.

Extracted command line arguments are stored in ConfigData object.

Note:
Only syntax supported right now `--argname=<argument>` - no spaces allowed around "=".
Parameters:
[in] argc number of command line words
[in] argv list of command line words/arguments
[out] config reference to modifiable ConfigData object

void Configuration::printConfig ( const ConfigData &  config  ) 

Print configuration.

Parameters:
[in] config reference to non-modifiable ConfigData object

bool Configuration::compareStrings ( const std::string &  str1,
const std::string &  str2,
bool  strong = true 
)

Case insensitive string comparator.

This function compares two strings without sensitivity to the case of the characters in them. It has two modes. The *strong* comparison is successful if all characters are identical (except case) and the number of characters in each string is identical, too. The weak comparison is successful if the the first n characters of a string are identical (except case). Here n is defined as the number of characters in the shorter string.

Parameters:
[in] str1 first string
[in] str2 second string
[in] strong optional, default true means strong comparison

template<class T>
bool Configuration::extractTag ( const std::string &  tagStr,
T &  value,
const std::string &  delimiter = "=" 
)

Basic generalization.

Works for all types which can be constructed from a std::string.

Parameters:
[in] tagStr string to be inspected
[out] value value to be extracted from string
[in] delimiter character before value (optional, default "=")
Returns:
true if value extraction worked.
